sentences: Ma hakkan aru saama, mida ta ütles.
context: The Estonian word 'hakkan' is the first-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'hakkama', meaning 'to start' or 'to begin'. It indicates that the speaker is about to initiate an action. For example, 'Hakkan tööle kell 9 hommikul' means 'I will/start working at 9 in the morning'. This verb commonly appears with time expressions to indicate when an action will commence.
